body:
Hi,

I got a question relate to ASHRAE 90.1-2010 Wall Construction from the EP Construction Library. I found out that the U-value from the EP Library does not match with ASHRAE 90.1-2010 exactly (for example, for Climate zone 1 Extmass Wall, EP Library offers U=0.649, whereas ASHRAE requires max 0.580 using IP Units). 

The other question is that is the library updated to ASHRAE 20.1-2013?

Thanks!

Best,

Rufei

replies.body:
Hi Rufei,

Thanks for reporting this. The libraries are from [OpenStudio standards](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/15-mlZrWbA4srtFHtWRP1dgPeuI5plFdjCb1B79fEukI/edit#gid=244387290).

[https://github.com/NREL/openstudio-standards/blob/master/openstudio...](https://github.com/NREL/openstudio-standards/blob/master/openstudio-standards/docs/AddingAStandard.md)

You can check the details in GoogleSheets. Let us know if we're making any mistakes.

Do you mean ASHRAE 90.1-2013? [Here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/15-mlZrWbA4srtFHtWRP1dgPeuI5plFdjCb1B79fEukI/edit#gid=4760944) are the standards that are available. We can update the libraries for the next release.

Mostapha

Hi Chris, Thanks for your detailed explanation, that makes a lot of sense. Now I understand why the EP Construction has a higher U-value than the code. But I got one question for ASHRAE 90.1-2010 Extwall Mass Climate zone 7-8, the U-value is 0.054, but the code is 0.071, should I change R-16.84 to R-11.2 in order to make a U-value of 0.075?  Best,
Rufei

Hi Mostapha, Thanks for your reply! I will take a look at this.  Best,
Rufei
